intro: Dendrobium textile var. textile, commonly known as the Orchid of the Clouds, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic plant that grows on trees and rocks, often in humid, tropical environments. The plant features long, cane-like stems covered in dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white, yellow, and pink. Its leaves are typically broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is cultivated for its striking floral display.
